bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Henry Hanson, June 3, 1922

div1.p: Carter requests data on the history of yellow fever in Peru.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Henry Hanson, June 3, 1922
div1.opener:
Book-
Peru & Ecuador
/LC
2121 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.
June 3, 1922.
Dear Doctor Hanson:
div1.p:
Could you please let me have--any time within two months or even
three would do--any data thay you can get up on the history of yellow
fever in Peru? I do not care about clinical or pathological history--
just its epidemiology, when and where it occurred and--roughly--the num-
ber of cases and deaths. This is especially desireable in the early
of its history.
div1.closer:
Very truly your friend, Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
2121 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
Similar letter to
Dr. Wenceslao Pareja,
Jefe de Sanidad,
Guayaquil, Ecuador, S. A.
